properties.name: Great Pyramid Of Giza
properties.description: Posted by Gordon92the Great Pyramid at Giza is thirty times larger than the empire state building, in mass, the pyramid\'s features are so large they can be see from the moon. this is the oldest structure in existence, having been started 4,617 years ago, it is the sole remment of the 7 wonders of the world. this great pyramid did not always look so rough as it does today origonally it was encased with a leayer of tight-fitting, highly poished stone slabs. W.M Finders Petrie determined the dimensions of the sides of the pyramids and he that they were near the exact length as they origonally were.

properties.name: Sphinx
properties.description: Posted by Gordon92this is the largest and best known sphinx it is near the great pyramid of giza. it is six miles west of cairo. this is the largest sculpted statue in the world, carved from the bedrock of the plateau. the sphinx faces east, to the rising sun near the 30th parallel, and may be the oldest monument on the giza plateau. the name "sphinx" was given to it in antiquity based on the legendary greek creature with a body of a lion and the head of a woman. the egyptian sphinx is differant having the head of a man or the head of a king. it is uncertain when the Sphinx was built and what it represents. It is commonly believed that the Sphinx was built by ancient Egyptians around 4,500 years ago.

properties.name: Statue of Liberty
properties.description: Posted by Gordon92New York Citythe statue of libertie is located on a 12 acre island. it was a gift of friendship from the people of France to the United States and is a universal symbol of freedom and democracy. The Statue of Liberty was dedicated on October 28, 1886, designated as a National Monument in 1924 and restored for its centennial on July 4, 1986.

properties.name: Stonehenge
properties.description: Posted by Gordon92Stonehenge, Englandstonehenge stands on an open area south of salisbury plain two miles west of the town of amesbury, wiltshire, in southern england. it is not a single structure but consists of a series of earth, timber, and stone structures that were revised and re-modeled over a period of more than 1400 years.

properties.name: golden gate bridge
properties.description: Posted by Gordon92san franciscothe golden gate bridge, was completed after more than four years of construction with the cost of 5 million . it\'s a tourist attraction tecognized worldwide. the golden gat bridge opened for vehicle traffic on may 28, 1937 at twelve p.m. ,which was ahead of scedule and under budget. the bridge links san frasisco with marin county the golden gate bridge is 1.7 mile long suspension bridge that can be crossed by car, by bicycle or on foot. The Golden Gate Bridge\'s 4,200 foot long main suspension span was a world record that stood for 27 years.The bridge\'s two towers rise 746 feet making them 191 feet taller than the Washington Monument.the towers that support the golden gate bridge suspension cables are smaller at the top than at the base, emphasizing the tower height of 500 ft above the road. The five lane bridge crosses Golden Gate Strait which is about 400 feet, or 130 meters, deep.

properties.name: great wall of china
properties.description: Posted by Gordon92chinaThere are huge disagreements regarding the length of the wall. One account puts the length of the wall at over 3,720 miles. Richard Nixon said it was 2,484 miles long, while Time magazine favored 1,684 miles. What is a fact is that the Great Wall of China extends from Kansu in the west to the Yellow Sea in the east. Ancient records reported that at least one million slaves and prisoners of war were used to build this wall. Many laborers died from exhaustion and starvation while working on this colossal task. Their bodies were added to the rubble and masonry as the quickest means of disposal. For centuries, the Wall was known as "the longest cemetery in the world." the great wall was not all built at once it was built in small parts then linked together later on.

properties.name: panama canal
properties.description: Posted by Gordon92panamain 1878 Fedinand de Lesseps, a french engineer who built the suez canal, began to dig a canal across the Isthmus of Panama, which was then part of Colombia. tropical disease and engineering problems alted construction on the canal, but a french buisness, the panamal canal company still held the rights, and he began to negotiate with colombia for controll of the land. he offered 10 million for a fify-mile strip across the sthmus. colombia refused. on august 15, 1914 the panama canal was official opened by passing of the SS Ancon. At the time, no single effort in American history had exacted such a price in dollars or in human life. Together the French and American expenditures totaled 39,000,000. It took 34 years from the initial effort in 1880 to actually open the Canal in 1914. It is estimated that over 80,000 persons took part in the construction and that over 30,000 lives were lost in both French and American efforts.

properties.name: roman colosiam
properties.description: Posted by Gordon92romeThe colosseum or Flavian Amphitheater was started by Vespasian, established by titus in 80 A.D. and completed by domitian. Located on marshy land between the esquilne and Caelian Hills, it was the first permanent amphitheater to be built in Rome. it was was made to acomidate large amounts of peaple with it\'s monumental size. it is a great architectual monument achieved by ancient romans the emphitheater was made to seat around 50,000 spectators around a central elliptical arena. below the wooden floor was acomplex set of tooms and passageways for wild beasts and other things to impress the spectators.

properties.name: the parthenon
properties.description: Posted by Gordon92greecethe parthenon is a temple that was built for the greek goddess athena in the 5th century bc on the athenian Acropolis. it is the most important surviving building of ancient greece. it\'s decorative sculptures are considered one of the high points of greek art. this parthenon was a replacement for an older temple of thena. which was destroyed in the persian invasian of 480 B.C. Like most greek temples the parthenon was used as a treasury, in the 6th century A.D. the parthenon was converted to a christian church dedicated to the virgin. after the ottoman conquest, it was converted into a mosque in the early 1460s. on september 28, 1687, an ottoman ammuntion inside the building was ignited by venetian bnombardment. the explosian greatly damaged the parthenon and it\'s art. later on Thomas bruce moved some and sold some of the surviving art with ottoman permission. today the Greek government is trying to return the sculptures to greece, so far they have had no success.

properties.name: the vatican
properties.description: Posted by Gordon92rome the vatican city is a land locked city-state whose territory is a walled enclave wihin the city of rome. it is about 110 acres and with a population of arond 800, it is the smallest independent stae in the world by both population and area. the vatican city came into existene by the lateran treaty in 1929. Vatican city is a non-hereditary, elected monaechy that is ruled by the bishop of rome-the pope. the city is where the pope lives.
